info.name: Instalment Policy
info.description: RestAPIs where customers can purchase products with installment policy from a stakeholder who has a shop selling various products. ### **Getting Started** To run the apis in the local environment you need to setup below **scripts (pre-requests)** and **variables** in this collection-

request.description:
List of all registered customers. All query params are optional.

Default values:

- `page: 1`
    
- `size: 10`
    
- `sort_by: id`
    
- `sort_dir: asc`
Pass customer id: /customers/{id}

Pass customer id: /customers/{id}

You can update either name or mobile or both
Pass customer id: /customers/{id}

item.name: Authentication Related APIs

request.description: Pass valid email and password(at least 8 character long) to the request body. Then verify the OTP that sent to the given email using `/auth/verify_otp` endpoint.

response.name: register customer

request.description:
Pass username(email) and password.

In response one of the value is: `"session_token": "value"`

Set the `session_token` value to the `authToken` environment variable's key of this API collection.
User can request to resen the OTP for 3 times. Pass the email address that user used to register.
Logged in user will logout and the session will expire.
OTP will be sent to the given email address. Need to verify the OTP in 3 attemps, otherwise user will be locked for 5 minutes.

item.description: APIs for customer registration, login, logout, verify OTP, resend OTP.

item.name: Product Related APIs

request.description: Only admin can add a product. Upload an image from your local machine.
Admin can update any number of fields. All fields are optional.
List all products details. Both admin and customer can see it.

response.name: get all products
response.body:

request.description: For both admin and customer. Get details of a particular product. Pass id: /products/{id}

response.name: get a product
response.body:
{
    "id": 2,
    "name": "BMW-L2",
    "description": "Lastest model of L2 series. Extra speed.",
    "price": 10000000,
    "quantity": 3,
    "category_id": 1,
    "category_name": "accessories",
    "image_url": "app/static/product_images/c0b1fe1f-3582-4f1f-8862-4515722cc055.jpg"
}

request.description: Admin can delete a product. Pass id: /products/{id}
Any user (admin, customer) can add a product to the cart. Pass id: /products/{id}/add-to-cart

item.description: Admin can apply CRUD operations to the product. Any user can add a product to the cart.

item.name: Category Related APIs

request.description: Pass only `category name` to create a category.
Get all category names and their ids.
Pass id: /categories/{id}
Pass id: /categories/{id}
Pass id: /categories/{id} as path variable and `name` as request body to update the category name. Category `name` must be `unique`.

item.description: Only admin can do the category related CRUD operations.

item.name: Cart-Item/Installment Related APIs
get all cart-item of current user

request.description: List of cart-items of the logged in user

response.name: get all cart-item of current user

request.description: Pass id: /carts/cart-item/{cart-item-id}

One can only remove a cart-item if that cart-item have no due. If there is not cart-item in a cart of an user, then the related cart will be deleted from the database automatically.

Pass id: /carts/cart-item/{cart-item-id}

response.name: delete cart-item

item.description: Any user (admin and customer) can do these operations.

item.name: Email Notiication APIs

request.description: Test api to send reminder email notification about installement due.

item.description:
Test api to send reminder email notification to the customer who have due.  
  
Main application will start a corn job every day at 9 AM to send the remainder email. Reminder email notification will be sent to the customer before 3, 1, 0 (can be change from the ENV variable of the application) days of the next installment date.

item.name: Admin Related APIs

request.description:
Both query parameters are option. By default `type=csv` and `weekly=true`.

Admin can generate csv or json report.

Other values of query params:

- `type: json`
    
- `weekly: false` (this will generate monthly report)
Admin can search by any query value. Numbers will show exact and partial results. Date must be exact. Other query param will show the partial results.
Admin can generate a `Due vs. Paid Amounts` bar-chart. **Response chart:**

item.description: APIs to search, generate reports and charts. Only for admin.
